intro: Hieracium deseglisei, commonly known as the Italian spearthistle, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features spiny leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in dry, sunny conditions. Its botanical structure makes it adaptable to various environments, though it is considered a weed in some areas.
